action.action-desc: Mr. Gallego (for himself and Mr. Zinke) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exclude from gross income the discharge of certain student loans of deceased or disabled veterans.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Veterans Education Tax Security Act of 2015 or the VETS Act of 2015.

section.header: Discharge of certain student loans of deceased or disabled veterans excluded from gross income

subsection.text: Section 108(f) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding to the end the following new paragraph:

paragraph.header: Discharge of certain student loans of deceased or disabled veterans excluded from gross income

clause.text: any veteran or member of the Armed Forces who dies,
any veteran whom the Secretary of Veterans Affairs determines has a service connected disability rated as total, or
with respect to any loan made to an individual described in clause (i) or (ii), any cosigner of such loan,

subparagraph.continuation-text: gross income shall not include any amount received under 437(a) of the Higher Education Act of 1965.

subparagraph.text: In the case of a parent of a member of the Armed Forces who dies, gross income shall not include any amount received under 437(d) of the Higher Education Act of 1965.

subsection.text: The amendment made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2014.
